be.ac.ulb.infof307.g09.controller.shapeDTO

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.ac.ulb.infof307.g09.controller.shapeDTO.ShapeDTO
      • be.ac.ulb.infof307.g09.controller.shapeDTO.Path
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Arrow, Line

    public class Path
extends Shape
    /!\ Only used in the package, use Arrow or line for the displaying a path. (subject to change later) Only support straight path for now eg : \draw (-1.5,0) -- (1.5,0) -- (0,-1.5) -- (0,1.5); A path can have arrow on both sides; eg : \draw [<->] for now, we only support one type of arrow.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Path(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> pathPoints, boolean arrowStart, boolean arrowEnd, Color drawColor, java.lang.String shapeThickness, int id)
      Personalised path with multiple points, with arrows and specified color.
      Path(java.util.ArrayList<Coordinates> pathPoints, java.lang.String shapeThickness, int id)
      Simple black path, no arrow.
      Path(Coordinates origin, Coordinates end, boolean arrowStart, boolean arrowEnd, Color drawColor, java.lang.String shapeThickness, int id)
      Personalised path with multiple points, with arrows and specified color.
      Path(Coordinates origin, Coordinates end, java.lang.String shapeThickness, int id, boolean arrowStart, boolean arrowEnd)
      Personalised path with only 2 points, with arrows and specified color.

      • print

        public java.lang.String print()
        Overrides:
        print in class Shape
        Returns:
        The Tikz code for these coordinates, intended to use in other print function of shapes, like rectangle. /!\ Print always add an extra " " empty character at the end, no need to add one if concatenating multiple Print result.
